body:
While following this [doc](http://kubernetes.io/docs/getting-started-guides/mesos/) to setup a kube-mesos integration env on my laptop, I found the default service account and default token are not created when start the cluster. As a result, I can not create a pod or deployment in this environment.

Reproduce steps:
1. Download the latest Mesos code, build and start 1 single master with 1 single agent.
2. Download the latest Kubernetes code, use `sudo KUBERNETES_CONTRIB=mesos make` to build.
3. Use the following commands to start apiserver, controller-manager and scheduler respectively:

```
km apiserver   --address=${KUBERNETES_MASTER_IP}   --etcd-servers=http://${KUBERNETES_MASTER_IP}:4001   --service-cluster-ip-range=10.10.10.0/24   --port=8888   --cloud-provider=mesos   --cloud-config=mesos-cloud.conf   --secure-port=0   --admission-control=NamespaceLifecycle,LimitRanger,SecurityContextDeny,ServiceAccount,ResourceQuota,DefaultStorageClass   --service-account-key-file=/home/k8s/k8s/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/cert/server.key   --service-account-lookup=false --bind-address=127.0.0.1   --insecure-bind-address=127.0.0.1   --insecure-port=8888 --v=3 --client-ca-file=/home/k8s/k8s/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/cert/ca.crt --tls-private-key-file=/home/k8s/k8s/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/cert/server.key>apiserver.log 2>&1 &

km controller-manager   --master=${KUBERNETES_MASTER_IP}:8888   --cloud-provider=mesos   --cloud-config=/home/k8s/k8s/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/mesos-cloud.conf    --service-account-private-key-file=/home/k8s/k8s/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/cert/server.key --root-ca-file=/home/k8s/k8s/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/cert/ca.crt   --enable-hostpath-provisioner=false   --v=3 >controller.log 2>&1 &

km scheduler   --address=${KUBERNETES_MASTER_IP}   --mesos-master=${MESOS_MASTER}   --etcd-servers=http://${KUBERNETES_MASTER_IP}:4001   --mesos-user=root   --api-servers=${KUBERNETES_MASTER_IP}:8888   --cluster-dns=10.10.10.10   --cluster-domain=cluster.local   --v=2 >scheduler.log 2>&1 &
```
1. After all the components are started, run `kubectl get serviceaccount` command and see that there is no default token created for the default namespace. At this moment, run "kubectl create -f pod.yml" will see the failure of creating a pod.
title: Can not run kube-mesos integration correctly when enable service account.
